meanings.definition: To extract the original information from a modulated carrier wave.
meanings.sent1: I learned how to demodulate the radio signal to hear the music clearly.
meanings.sent2: The technician will demodulate the encrypted data to reveal its contents.
meanings.sent3: Trying to demodulate the cat's meows to understand its message was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: She had to demodulate his cryptic text messages to decipher his true feelings.
meanings.sent5: The detective's job was to demodulate the suspect's alibi and uncover the truth.

meanings.definition: To convert a modulated signal into its original form.
meanings.sent1: We need to demodulate the distorted audio signal to hear the original recording.
meanings.sent2: The device will demodulate the digital transmission back into its analog form.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to demodulate the scrambled cards back to their original order, but failed hilariously.
meanings.sent4: Her smile seemed to demodulate the tension in the room, bringing a sense of calm.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brushstrokes demodulate the chaos into a beautiful masterpiece.
